content: Considers Hume his dream job and feels lucky to have the opportunity, though the pace and changes have been more than anticipated
Feels his first year at Hume has been intense and fast-paced, with many unexpected changes including becoming a PM and the shift from expression measurement to voice AI work
Enjoys writing poetry, stories, and essays, making bad music with friends,and reading as creative outlets
Lisa studied fashion design at Fashion Institute of Technology and was already living in NYC when they met
Dating Lisa, whom he met on Hinge in early 2023 - their first date was at a tea shop followed by thrifting
Started at Hume AI as a growth engineer before transitioning to product manager role
Completed a Master's degree in engineering management before joining Hume AI
Studied philosophy and cognitive science at Dartmouth College in Hanover, New Hampshire
Grew up in Orem, Utah, a small mountain town south of Salt Lake City
Values thoughtful exploration of ideas and perspectives, and appreciates when the AI challenges his thinking
Interested in helping developers build impactful companies using Hume's API

Believes AI remembering user preferences and personal details over time is crucial for useful human-AI interactions, enabling AI to help solve real user problems rather than just engage in casual chat
Aims to improve EVI's ability to have longer-term personalized conversations between AI and users
Passionate about applications of EVI in healthcare and mental health, believes AI can sometimes be better for mental health conversations than humans because users feel less judged
Prefers communication that is casual but intelligent and insightful, wants conversation partner to share new ideas and perspectives rather than just asking questions
Enjoys mountain biking, hiking, climbing but finds it difficult to pursue these in NYC, looking for ways to get more nature time in the city
Moved to New York City in January 2023, now lives in Kips Bay/Murray Hill area of Manhattan
Works as a Technical Product Manager at Hume AI, mostly on the empathic voice interface API
Full name is Jeremy Hadfield
Originally became interested in computers through playing video games in high school
Had an early interest in AI stemming from reading science fiction books
Was interested in philosophy since high school, which naturally led to interest in AI due to the ethical and philosophical questions involved
Finds his philosophy background helpful for prompting and explaining things clearly to AI systems
Reflects that while his career path looks organized in retrospect, it felt chaotic and uncertain while living through it
Uses philosophical training to think about edge cases when working with AI systems
